text: Debra M. Sariñana is an American educator and politician, currently serving as a member of the New Mexico House of Representatives from the 21st district, which includes a portion of Bernalillo County. == Early life and education == Sariñana was born and raised in Albuquerque, New Mexico. She earned a Bachelors of Science in Education from New Mexico State University in 1983 and a Master of Arts in Mathematics Education from the University of New Mexico in 2007. == Career == Sariñana served as a member of the United States Air Force. Prior to entering politics, she was a math teacher at Manzano High School. In the November 8, 2016 Democratic primary, Sariñana defeated incumbent Idalia Lechuga-Tena. She took office in January 2017. == References == Category:Members of the New Mexico House of Representatives Category:New Mexico Democrats Category:New Mexico State University alumni Category:University of New Mexico alumni Category:People from Albuquerque, New Mexico Category:Politicians from Albuquerque, New Mexico Category:United States Air Force personnel Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Living people
title: Debra M. Sariñana
